examples: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

flashcards.meaning: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically
examples: She took a pragmatic approach to solving the problem.

flashcards.meaning: Showing great attention to detail; very careful
examples: He was meticulous in his research.

flashcards.meaning: Open to more than one interpretation; unclear

grammar.title: Conditional - Third (Unreal Past)
grammar.pattern: If + past perfect, would have + past participle
grammar.meaning: Imaginary situations in the past and their hypothetical results

examples.english: If I had studied harder, I would have passed.
examples.translation: Regret about an unchangeable past situation.
examples.explanation: Past condition (didn't happen) → past result (didn't happen)

examples.english: If she had known, she would have helped.
examples.explanation: She didn't know, so she didn't help

grammar.notes: Often used to express regret about the past

grammar.title: Passive Voice - Complex Forms
grammar.meaning: Focus on the action or object rather than the doer
grammar.notes: Use passive when the agent is unknown, unimportant, or obvious

practice.question: What does 'ubiquitous' mean?
practice.explanation: Ubiquitous means being present, appearing, or found everywhere.

practice.question: Complete: If I ___ (know) earlier, I would have come.
practice.explanation: Third conditional uses 'if + past perfect' for unreal past conditions.

games.title: Academic Vocabulary
games.description: Test your knowledge of academic vocabulary
